summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting court authorization to subpoena the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program for documents related to four accusers in her criminal case. The motion argues the documents are needed to impeach the accusers' credibility at trial, revealing they received millions in compensation from the fund.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, accused of conspiring to violate the Mann Act and sex trafficking statutes with Jeffrey Epstein. Her defense team is filing this motion to subpoena victim compensation records.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C., signed the motion and is listed as counsel.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C., listed as counsel on the motion.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from COHEN & GRESSER LLP, listed as counsel on the motion.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, listed as counsel on the motion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the co-conspirator with Maxwell in the sex trafficking conspiracy. The motion references his estate, the victim compensation fund, and prior lawsuits against him.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Person who certified service of the motion on November 14, 2021.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to recruit, entice, and transport minors for illegal sexual activity and commercial sex acts.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell and signed the motion on her behalf.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.
Stemheim is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell on the motion.

events.title: Government Begins 3500 Material Production
events.description: The government began producing discovery material (3500 material) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, which included information about accusers receiving compensation.

events.title: Court Conference on Witness Designation
events.description: A court conference was held where the court ruled on referring to one individual as 'Witness-3' instead of 'Accuser-3'.

events.title: Filing of Motion for Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed this motion requesting court authorization to subpoena the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program.

events.title: Indictment Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in June 2019. The motion notes this indictment did not include the allegations of the four accusers in Maxwell's S2 Indictment.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense sought to subpoena the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program for documents related to four accusers (Accuser-1, Accuser-2, Accuser-4, and Witness-3) to impeach their credibility at trial.
The motion reveals the four accusers received substantial payments from the compensation fund: Accuser-1 ($5M), Accuser-2 ($1.5M), Witness-3 ($3.25M), and Accuser-4 ($3.5M).
The defense argues the compensation fund's protocol rewarded claimants if prosecution against Maxwell proceeded, creating a financial motive for the accusers.

The motion details the charges against Maxwell: conspiracy and substantive violations of the Mann Act (Counts 1-4) and sex trafficking conspiracy and violation (Counts 5-6), involving accusers who were minors.
Lawyers for Accuser-2 and Witness-3 were reportedly instrumental in creating the terms of the Epstein Victim Compensation Program protocol.
